videostream

Class NioSslServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • videostream.NioSslPeer
      • videostream.NioSslServer

  • public class NioSslServer
extends NioSslPeer
    An SSL/TLS server, that will listen to a specific address and port and serve SSL/TLS connections compatible with the protocol it applies.

    After initialization start() should be called so the server starts to listen to new connection requests. At this point, start is blocking, so, in order to be able to gracefully stop the server, a Runnable containing a server object should be created. This runnable should start the server in its run method and also provide a stop method, which will call stop().

    NioSslServer makes use of Java NIO, and specifically listens to new connection requests with a ServerSocketChannel, which will create new SocketChannels and a Selector which serves all the connections in one thread.

      • NioSslServer

        public NioSslServer(java.lang.String protocol,
                    java.lang.String hostAddress,
                    int port)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Server is designed to apply an SSL/TLS protocol and listen to an IP address and port.
        Parameters:
        protocol - - the SSL/TLS protocol that this server will be configured to apply.
        hostAddress - - the IP address this server will listen to.
        port - - the port this server will listen to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Should be called in order the server to start listening to new connections. This method will run in a loop as long as the server is active. In order to stop the server you should use stop() which will set it to inactive state and also wake up the listener, which may be in blocking select() state.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Sets the server to an inactive state, in order to exit the reading loop in start() and also wakes up the selector, which may be in select() blocking state.

      • read

        protected void read(java.nio.channels.SocketChannel socketChannel,
                    javax.net.ssl.SSLEngine engine)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Will be called by the selector when the specific socket channel has data to be read. As soon as the server reads these data, it will call NioSslServer#write(SocketChannel, SSLEngine, String) to send back a trivial response.
        Specified by:
        read in class NioSslPeer
        Parameters:
        socketChannel - - the transport link used between the two peers.
        engine - - the engine used for encryption/decryption of the data exchanged between the two peers.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs to the socket channel.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        message - - the message to be sent.
